intro: Cycnoches lehmannii, commonly known as the Lehmann's cycnoches, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its terrestrial growth habit and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically produces pale yellow to greenish-white blooms with intricate patterns on the petals. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
